info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:34PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Robeson, northwestern Columbus, southeastern Florence, northeastern Georgetown, southeastern Dillon, Horry, Marion and northeastern Williamsburg Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 433 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Marion to near Warsaw. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Myrtle Beach, Conway, Marion, Mullins, Surfside Beach, Myrtle Beach Airport, Murrells Inlet, Socastee, Red Hill, Springmaid Pier, Garden City, Horry, Tabor City, Loris, Chadbourn, Johnsonville, Pamplico, Fair Bluff, Hemingway and Hickory Grove. This includes the following highways... SC Highway 31 between mile markers 5 and 10. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 1 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
